intro: Sida stellata, commonly known as starlingweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Sida stellata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
